channel.title: How to make ::Pickup mod+, instead if admin+
channel.description: anyone know how i make ::pickup mod+ instead of admin+? its 317 server.

item.title: How to make ::Pickup mod+, instead if admin+
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 1)) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

Read full topic

dont forget java is case sensitive

item.title: How to make ::Pickup mod+, instead if admin+
item.dc:creator: @Menno582 Menno582
item.description:
@Menno582 wrote:

[quote=“kickingjamie, post:4, topic:272450”]if you wan’t it for only mods change it to this:

playerrights == 1[/quote]

Yeah playerrights 0, means for everyone,
1 means for moderators, 2 means for administrators,
3 means for owners/co owners

Read full topic

item.title: How to make ::Pickup mod+, instead if admin+
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

In the if statement part you will see a playerRight = 2 or someting similiar change that to one and compile it.

But admins can still use it + any higher.
